egl.math

Class Vector3d

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<java.lang.Double>
        • egl.math.Vector3d
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Double>, java.util.Collection<java.lang.Double>, java.util.List<java.lang.Double>

    public class Vector3d
extends java.util.AbstractList<java.lang.Double>
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A 3-Component Vector
    Double Precision
      Argument Usage Identifiers:
 [POS]  - Position
 [OFF]  - Offset Between Positions
 [DIR]  - Normalized Direction
 [DIRN] - Direction (Scale Allowable)
 [ARR]  - Array Of Doubles
 [OUT]  - Non-Null Output
    Author:
    Cristian

 Ret dot(off, off)

        Parameters:
        v - Vector
        epsilon - Approximation Factor
        Returns:
        True If Maximum Difference Between Components Less Than epsilon In Magnitude

        public boolean equalsApprox(Vector3d v)
        Checks Approximate Component Equality Between This Vector And Another
        Parameters:
        v - Vector
        Returns:
        True If Maximum Difference Between Components Less Than 1e-8 In Magnitude
